TopicTitle: Laythecat is bestcat. (Chobit's house of madness) The one thread to rule them all!

Articles.Content:
Still has an account.

We're just tidying things up a bit.

And the rules got a major overhaul

And the rules got a major overhaul

Put the war on hold, now I gotta go read the rules. Hope it's still common sense stuff.

EDIT: Yup. The Backseat Moderation rule is new, I think. Back to WAR!

Edited May 21, 2013 by The Jedi Master

Fleet is currently forming a blockade around Polaris. We also built three clones of Yamamoto, so be ready for a heck of a fight.

Why are you attacking Seal Army? We are HELPING attacking redwolfy. We aren't attacking Chobit.

Put the war on hold, now I gotta go read the rules. Hope it's still common sense stuff.

It's still some the basic rules, but with improvement in areas and trimming of the partially unnessicary stuff.

TL;DR: Read it again.

And the rules got a major overhaul

That too.

Put the war on hold, now I gotta go read the rules. Hope it's still common sense stuff.

Indeed it is. They're much the same as the old rules, however, they're far more concise, easier to follow and apply to the entire KSP Network.
Finished reading the new rules. Now, back to attacking redwolfy.

Finished reading the new rules. Now, back to attacking redwolfy.

Any progress?

Why are you attacking Seal Army? We are HELPING attacking redwolfy. We aren't attacking Chobit.

Sorry. 5th Fleet recalled, 6th and 5th Fleets are now besieging Redwolfy.

Any progress?

Other than backfires, no.

Its not destroyed, its been rebooted. Anyway, did you like Into Darkness?

Yup. OMG, did I like it. Enough continuity with the original series, but enough new stuff to really make it interesting.

Of course, I watch movies emotionally. So, easily-detected plot twists (SHUT UP CHOBIT! xD I caught on eventually) were less noticeable.

I really didn't like Uhura's role in this one. Although I kinda understand how she feels, bringing up relationship issues in front of fellow crew is bad form. Also, she SO should not be dating a ranking officer...

It was really funny, though. You could so tell who the Trekkies in the audience were. I got weird looks for awhile, though. Was wearing my "Trekkie" Tshirt. You'd think no one expects a woman to like Star Trek!

s

Any progress?

We are sending in Seal Army ground troops to attack her base. The Excalibur MkII is also aimed at her base, incase things get out of hand. Seal Army hover tanks and military spaceplanes are also in the area.

We are sending in Seal Army ground troops to attack her base. The Excalibur MkII is also aimed at her base, incase things get out of hand. Seal Army hover tanks and military spaceplanes are also in the area.

Good. With the authorization of both you and the Supreme Commander (me), we can fire the first missiles. Do you confirm?

Of course, I watch movies emotionally.

Do you play video games emotionally? Portal 2 is the most emotional game I have ever played, becuase the boss scene left a mark on me for the rest of my life. If Portal 2 isn't right for you (then get out of here), try the Mass Effect series.

Good. With the authorization of both you and the Supreme Commander (me), we can fire the first missiles. Do you confirm?

Confirmed. Fire the missile!

20 pages in less than a day. Words cannot express my feelings.

Fortunately, I have animated GIFs.

Remember kids, don't drink and drive!

Good. With the authorization of both you and the Supreme Commander (me), we can fire the first missiles. Do you confirm?

The International Earth 5th Fleet has showed up. Several of their Heavy Assault Ion Cannons are moving into position. One of the "United States"-class Heavy Dreadnaughts have released an anti-matter bomb at their base. Our troops have established a beachhead, at the cost of around 600 lives. Fifteen heavy fighter squadrons are in the air.

Humanity is going badass on this one. We also have the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Fleets guarding earth. They have around give times the number of the fifteen fleet. Rede idly cannot attack our homeworld.

Note: Roleplaying on the KSP forum is discouraged.

Though if you want to fashion this into an actual story and continue it, I know a few places that would gladly go with it.

I have dispatched the Sixth Fleet to Eden Prime, redwolfys main colony.

We have fifty regiments of Orbital Drop Shock Heavy Assault Troopers attacking the planet. Also, the anti-matter bomb has struck the base. I have fifty thousand men in the ground, they are clearing the area.

Note: Roleplaying on the KSP forum is discouraged.

Though if you want to fashion this into an actual story and continue it, I know a few places that would gladly go with it.

Gah, I don't need another account for the Roleplay forum. Having all these drives me insane.

Do you play video games emotionally? Portal 2 is the most emotional game I have ever played, becuase the boss scene left a mark on me for the rest of my life. If Portal 2 isn't right for you (then get out of here), try the Mass Effect series.

Not a big game player. But the ones I do play, if they have a storyline, holy COW do I get emotionally involved. Take Minecraft, for example. I make up the story as I go. Or tell different stories depending on what I'm doing in the world. Heck, I have one world dedicated to set design for Stories-I-Want-To-Tell-But-Lack-The-Writing-Ability.

That said, I have heard great things about both Portal and Mass Effect. And I do wish to play them. Someday.
Trekkette, get portal 1 and 2 play them, it is a great experience. Also this thread is CRAZY
I can vouch that the first Portal is good. Still have yet to play the second one.

> reads the last 20 pages

> sighs

I can vouch that the first Portal is good. Still have yet to play the second one.

The second portal is a huge improvement on the first, I strongly suggest trying it.

The second portal is a huge improvement on the first, I strongly suggest trying it.

The first was a basic prototype, Portal 2 was the main event
